displaytitle: Patricia and Dawn and Friends from the series " A Positive Life: Portraits of Women Living with HIV"
creditline: Museum purchase, gift of Merrill Lynch & Co., Inc.
inscribed: Signed / inscribed in ink, verso lower right corner: Mary Berridge, 1996

titles.title: Patricia and Dawn and Friends from the series " A Positive Life: Portraits of Women Living with HIV"

texts.textentryhtml: The series from which this photograph comes was first published in book form in 1997, just as the first treatments that led to longer-term survival for many people living with HIV were being introduced. The blurred presence of three naked children against the clothed adult figure’s grounded solidity, along with the woman’s upturned and affectionate gaze, gives the work narrative qualities typical of Berridge’s work, which often focuses on individuals finding meaning under difficult circumstances. Such strategies also allow the relationship between adult and children to be intentionally ambiguous, just as the fates awaiting the figures—are the children to be read as spectral presences?—remain unclear.

bibliography.boilertext: "Acquisitions of the Princeton University Art Museum 2001," Record of the Princeton University Art Museum 61 (2002): p. 101-142.
bibliography.citation: "Acquisitions of the Princeton University Art Museum 2001," Record of the Princeton University Art Museum 61 (2002): p. 101-142., p. 123

exhibitions.citation: States of Health: Visualizing Illness and Healing (November 2, 2019 –Sunday, February 2, 2020)
